item.title: 4. FAQ
item.description:
Officially supported:Bash & Zsh Other POSIX-compliant shells should work but are not officially tested. However, any fixes will be accepted. When all planned features for initial release will be completed. For the methods:-
If you know shell scripting, browse the source code starting from executable script Functions have comments showing how to use them(like args, output etc..). For the Docs:-
Clone this repo. Install obsidian.
Open the notes as a obsidian vault. It contains plugins, settings.
Install obsidian-webpage-export plugin. Then export to html using obsidian-webpage-export form the ribbon to the docs directory of the cloned repo.

item.title: 2. Initialization
item.description:
Warning Although Kit is stable enough now Things are subject to change as this project is in alpha stage . Major changes are being made until stable release. # Required export PROJECT_NAME="Project Name" # Optional export CACHE_DIR="/path/to/cache/dir" export LOG_FILE_NAME="log_file_name" Some variable(s) must be exported at the very top of your script, even before sourcing KireiSakura-Kit. It provides essential metadata that the kit uses during setup.Specifies the name of your project. ⚠️ KireiSakura-Kit won't start without this one. Default: NULL (Kit will throw an error if not set.) Defines the directory path where KireiSakura-Kit will store temporary files. Default: If $XDG_CONFIG_HOME is set: $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/<project name> Otherwise: ~/.config/<project name> Specifies the name of the log file. The log file will be created at: <CACHE_DIR>/<LOG_FILE_NAME>.log Default: <PROJECT_NAME>.log Prerequisites Make sure you have curl, grep installed. Install figlet too for the header. (optional) Add below lines to your script. This will check if KireiSakura Kit is installed or download & source the kit:-if command -v kireisakura &> /dev/null; then eval "$(kireisakura --init)" else clear -x && echo echo "> Downloading KireiSakura-Kit" curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/soymadip/KireiSakura-Kit/refs/heads/install/install.sh -o kirestaller.sh bash kirestaller.sh -ds fi you can also only install KireiSakura Kit in your system Run this command in your terminal:- curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/soymadip/KireiSakura-Kit/refs/heads/install/install.sh | bash -s By default KireiSakura Kit only imports core modules.Modules are imported using kimport method. To import plugin modules:- #import specific modules kimport disk-utils change-shell enable-os-prober #import all modules at once kimport -a
To import user modules use -l flag:- kimport -l module1 module2 module3 #to import all modules kimport -l -a
Done Now that Initialization is complete, you can use methods to build script.

item.title: 0. Home
item.description:
KireiSakura-Kit is a library written in Bash for making powerful shell scripts.
Written in purely bash, can be used in POSIX* shell script. Modular, import only stuff you need. Log support, with various levels. Many in-built methods, no need to write from scratch. Various UI elements.
See TODO for upcoming features.
Docs Repo

item.title: 1. Terminologies
item.description:
1st, let's understand some terms used throughout the Docs.Methods are the functions exposed by Modules. They are the primary API for interacting with KireiSakura-Kit. Modules are self-contained scripts that store methods. Each module performs a specific task and can be sourced as needed. There are 3 types are modules:-These are essential components of the KireiSakura-Kit providing the foundational functionality required for the framework to operate. These are automatically loaded at start. These are optional modules used to extend the functionality of the framework.
These are required to be loaded implicitly using kimport function.
These are similar to plugin modules except these are designed & implemented by the user.Info Create user modules by making a directory called modules in the project root. <PROJECT_ROOT> |-main.sh |-modules/ | |-module1.sh |-module2.sh
Done Now that you know the terms, head to Initialization to start sourcing Kit.
